// Flags for ImDrawList functions
// (Legacy: bit 0 must always correspond to ImDrawFlags_Closed to be backward compatible with old API using a bool. Bits 1..3 must be unused)

// Flags for ImDrawList instance. Those are set automatically by ImGui:: functions from ImGuiIO settings, and generally not manipulated directly.
// It is however possible to temporarily alter flags between calls to ImDrawList:: functions.

ImGuiBackendFlags_.above: // Backend capabilities flags stored in io.BackendFlags. Set by imgui_impl_xxx or custom backend.

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.above: // Flags for ColorEdit3() / ColorEdit4() / ColorPicker3() / ColorPicker4() / ColorButton()

// Flags for ImGui::InputText()

ImGuiMouseButton_.above:
// Identify a mouse button.
// Those values are guaranteed to be stable and we frequently use 0/1 directly. Named enums provided for convenience.

ImGuiMouseCursor_.above:
// Enumeration for GetMouseCursor()
// User code may request backend to display given cursor by calling SetMouseCursor(), which is why we have some cursors that are marked unused here

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // PathStroke(), AddPolyline(): specify that shape should be closed (Important: this is always == 1 for legacy reason)
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_Closed

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding top-left corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x01.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding top-right corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x02.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding bottom-left corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x04.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding bottom-right corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Wax 0x08.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): disable rounding on all corners (when rounding > 0.0f). This is NOT zero, NOT an implicit flag!
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // Default to ALL corners if none of the _RoundCornersXX flags are specified.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersDefault_

ImDrawListFlags_.comment: // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders (*2 the number of triangles for 1.0f wide line or lines thin enough to be drawn using textures, otherwise *3 the number of triangles)
ImDrawListFlags_.name: ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines

ImDrawListFlags_.comment: // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders using textures when possible. Require backend to render with bilinear filtering (NOT point/nearest filtering).
ImDrawListFlags_.name: ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLinesUseTex

ImDrawListFlags_.comment: // Enable anti-aliased edge around filled shapes (rounded rectangles, circles).
ImDrawListFlags_.name: ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedFill

ImDrawListFlags_.comment: // Can emit 'VtxOffset > 0' to allow large meshes. Set when 'ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset' is enabled.
ImDrawListFlags_.name: ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset

ImFontAtlasFlags_.comment: // Don't round the height to next power of two
ImFontAtlasFlags_.name: ImFontAtlasFlags_NoPowerOfTwoHeight

ImFontAtlasFlags_.comment: // Don't build software mouse cursors into the atlas (save a little texture memory)
ImFontAtlasFlags_.name: ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors

ImFontAtlasFlags_.comment: // Don't build thick line textures into the atlas (save a little texture memory, allow support for point/nearest filtering). The AntiAliasedLinesUseTex features uses them, otherwise they will be rendered using polygons (more expensive for CPU/GPU).
ImFontAtlasFlags_.name: ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines

ImGuiBackendFlags_.comment: // Backend Platform supports gamepad and currently has one connected.
ImGuiBackendFlags_.name: ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad

ImGuiBackendFlags_.comment: // Backend Platform supports honoring GetMouseCursor() value to change the OS cursor shape.
ImGuiBackendFlags_.name: ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors

ImGuiBackendFlags_.comment: // Backend Platform supports io.WantSetMousePos requests to reposition the OS mouse position (only used if ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos is set).
ImGuiBackendFlags_.name: ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos

ImGuiBackendFlags_.comment: // Backend Renderer supports ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset. This enables output of large meshes (64K+ vertices) while still using 16-bit indices.
ImGuiBackendFlags_.name: ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset

ImGuiBackendFlags_.comment: // Backend Platform supports calling io.AddMouseViewportEvent() with the viewport under the mouse. IF POSSIBLE, ignore viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag (Win32 backend, GLFW 3.30+ backend can do this, SDL backend cannot). If this cannot be done, Dear ImGui needs to use a flawed heuristic to find the viewport under.
ImGuiBackendFlags_.name: ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport

ImGuiChildFlags_.comment: // Show an outer border and enable WindowPadding. (IMPORTANT: this is always == 1 == true for legacy reason)
ImGuiChildFlags_.name: ImGuiChildFlags_Border

ImGuiChildFlags_.comment: // Pad with style.WindowPadding even if no border are drawn (no padding by default for non-bordered child windows because it makes more sense)
ImGuiChildFlags_.name: ImGuiChildFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding

ImGuiChildFlags_.comment: // Allow resize from right border (layout direction). Enable .ini saving (unless ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings passed to window flags)
ImGuiChildFlags_.name: ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeX

ImGuiChildFlags_.comment: // Allow resize from bottom border (layout direction). "
ImGuiChildFlags_.name: ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeY

ImGuiChildFlags_.comment: // Enable auto-resizing width. Read "IMPORTANT: Size measurement" details above.
ImGuiChildFlags_.name: ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeX

ImGuiChildFlags_.comment: // Enable auto-resizing height. Read "IMPORTANT: Size measurement" details above.
ImGuiChildFlags_.name: ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeY

ImGuiChildFlags_.comment: // Combined with AutoResizeX/AutoResizeY. Always measure size even when child is hidden, always return true, always disable clipping optimization! NOT RECOMMENDED.
ImGuiChildFlags_.name: ImGuiChildFlags_AlwaysAutoResize

ImGuiChildFlags_.comment: // Style the child window like a framed item: use FrameBg, FrameRounding, FrameBorderSize, FramePadding instead of ChildBg, ChildRounding, ChildBorderSize, WindowPadding.
ImGuiChildFlags_.name: ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Background of popups, menus, tooltips windows
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_PopupBg

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Background of checkbox, radio button, plot, slider, text input
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_FrameBg

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Header* colors are used for CollapsingHeader, TreeNode, Selectable, MenuItem
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_Header

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Resize grip in lower-right and lower-left corners of windows.
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Preview overlay color when about to docking something
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_DockingPreview

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Background color for empty node (e.g. CentralNode with no window docked into it)
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_DockingEmptyBg

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Table outer and header borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Table inner borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Darken/colorize entire screen behind the CTRL+TAB window list, when active
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg

ImGuiCol_.comment: // Darken/colorize entire screen behind a modal window, when one is active
ImGuiCol_.name: ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: ignore Alpha component (will only read 3 components from the input pointer).
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit: disable picker when clicking on color square.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit: disable toggling options menu when right-clicking on inputs/small preview.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable color square preview next to the inputs. (e.g. to show only the inputs)
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable inputs sliders/text widgets (e.g. to show only the small preview color square).
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable tooltip when hovering the preview.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable display of inline text label (the label is still forwarded to the tooltip and picker).
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorPicker: disable bigger color preview on right side of the picker, use small color square preview instead.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit: disable drag and drop target. ColorButton: disable drag and drop source.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorButton: disable border (which is enforced by default)
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: show vertical alpha bar/gradient in picker.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display preview as a transparent color over a checkerboard, instead of opaque.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display half opaque / half checkerboard, instead of opaque.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: //              // (WIP) ColorEdit: Currently only disable 0.0f..1.0f limits in RGBA edition (note: you probably want to use ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float flag as well).
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: // [Display]    // ColorEdit: override _display_ type among RGB/HSV/Hex. ColorPicker: select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: // [Display]    // "
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: // [Display]    // "
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: // [DataType]   // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0..255.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: // [DataType]   // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0.0f..1.0f floats instead of 0..255 integers. No round-trip of value via integers.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: // [Picker]     // ColorPicker: bar for Hue, rectangle for Sat/Value.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: // [Picker]     // ColorPicker: wheel for Hue, triangle for Sat/Value.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: // [Input]      // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in RGB format.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB

ImGuiColorEditFlags_.comment: // [Input]      // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in HSV format.
ImGuiColorEditFlags_.name: ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV

ImGuiComboFlags_.comment: // Align the popup toward the left by default
ImGuiComboFlags_.name: ImGuiComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft

ImGuiComboFlags_.comment: // Max ~4 items visible. Tip: If you want your combo popup to be a specific size you can use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() prior to calling BeginCombo()
ImGuiComboFlags_.name: ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall

ImGuiComboFlags_.comment: // As many fitting items as possible
ImGuiComboFlags_.name: ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest

ImGuiComboFlags_.comment: // Display on the preview box without the square arrow button
ImGuiComboFlags_.name: ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton

ImGuiComboFlags_.comment: // Display only a square arrow button
ImGuiComboFlags_.name: ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview

ImGuiComboFlags_.comment: // Width dynamically calculated from preview contents
ImGuiComboFlags_.name: ImGuiComboFlags_WidthFitPreview

ImGuiCond_.comment: // No condition (always set the variable), same as _Always
ImGuiCond_.name: ImGuiCond_None

ImGuiCond_.comment: // No condition (always set the variable), same as _None
ImGuiCond_.name: ImGuiCond_Always

ImGuiCond_.comment: // Set the variable once per runtime session (only the first call will succeed)
ImGuiCond_.name: ImGuiCond_Once

ImGuiCond_.comment: // Set the variable if the object/window has no persistently saved data (no entry in .ini file)
ImGuiCond_.name: ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver

ImGuiCond_.comment: // Set the variable if the object/window is appearing after being hidden/inactive (or the first time)
ImGuiCond_.name: ImGuiCond_Appearing

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // Master keyboard navigation enable flag. Enable full Tabbing + directional arrows + space/enter to activate.
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // Master gamepad navigation enable flag. Backend also needs to set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad.
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // Instruct navigation to move the mouse cursor. May be useful on TV/console systems where moving a virtual mouse is awkward. Will update io.MousePos and set io.WantSetMousePos=true. If enabled you MUST honor io.WantSetMousePos requests in your backend, otherwise ImGui will react as if the mouse is jumping around back and forth.
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // Instruct navigation to not set the io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag when io.NavActive is set.
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // Instruct imgui to clear mouse position/buttons in NewFrame(). This allows ignoring the mouse information set by the backend.
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // Instruct backend to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility. Use if the backend cursor changes are interfering with yours and you don't want to use SetMouseCursor() to change mouse cursor. You may want to honor requests from imgui by reading GetMouseCursor() yourself instead.
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // Viewport enable flags (require both ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports + ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports set by the respective backends)
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Reposition and resize imgui windows when the DpiScale of a viewport changed (mostly useful for the main viewport hosting other window). Note that resizing the main window itself is up to your application.
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleViewports

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Request bitmap-scaled fonts to match DpiScale. This is a very low-quality workaround. The correct way to handle DPI is _currently_ to replace the atlas and/or fonts in the Platform_OnChangedViewport callback, but this is all early work in progress.
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts

ImGuiConfigFlags_.comment: // Application is using a touch screen instead of a mouse.
ImGuiConfigFlags_.name: ImGuiConfigFlags_IsTouchScreen

ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.comment: //       // Don't display the dockspace node but keep it alive. Windows docked into this dockspace node won't be undocked.
ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.name: ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly

ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.comment: //       // Disable docking over the Central Node, which will be always kept empty.
ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.name: ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverCentralNode

ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.comment: //       // Enable passthru dockspace: 1) DockSpace() will render a ImGuiCol_WindowBg background covering everything excepted the Central Node when empty. Meaning the host window should probably use SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.0f) prior to Begin() when using this. 2) When Central Node is empty: let inputs pass-through + won't display a DockingEmptyBg background. See demo for details.
ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.name: ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode

ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.comment: //       // Disable other windows/nodes from splitting this node.
ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.name: ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit

ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.comment: // Saved // Disable resizing node using the splitter/separators. Useful with programmatically setup dockspaces.
ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.name: ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize

ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.comment: //       // Tab bar will automatically hide when there is a single window in the dock node.
ImGuiDockNodeFlags_.name: ImGuiDockNodeFlags_AutoHideTabBar

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // Disable preview tooltip. By default, a successful call to BeginDragDropSource opens a tooltip so you can display a preview or description of the source contents. This flag disables this behavior.
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // By default, when dragging we clear data so that IsItemHovered() will return false, to avoid subsequent user code submitting tooltips. This flag disables this behavior so you can still call IsItemHovered() on the source item.
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // Disable the behavior that allows to open tree nodes and collapsing header by holding over them while dragging a source item.
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // Allow items such as Text(), Image() that have no unique identifier to be used as drag source, by manufacturing a temporary identifier based on their window-relative position. This is extremely unusual within the dear imgui ecosystem and so we made it explicit.
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // External source (from outside of dear imgui), won't attempt to read current item/window info. Will always return true. Only one Extern source can be active simultaneously.
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // Automatically expire the payload if the source cease to be submitted (otherwise payloads are persisting while being dragged)
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // AcceptDragDropPayload() will returns true even before the mouse button is released. You can then call IsDelivery() to test if the payload needs to be delivered.
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // Do not draw the default highlight rectangle when hovering over target.
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // Request hiding the BeginDragDropSource tooltip from the BeginDragDropTarget site.
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip

ImGuiDragDropFlags_.comment: // For peeking ahead and inspecting the payload before delivery.
ImGuiDragDropFlags_.name: ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly

ImGuiFocusedFlags_.comment: // Return true if any children of the window is focused
ImGuiFocusedFlags_.name: ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows

ImGuiFocusedFlags_.comment: // Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy)
ImGuiFocusedFlags_.name: ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow

ImGuiFocusedFlags_.comment: // Return true if any window is focused. Important: If you are trying to tell how to dispatch your low-level inputs, do NOT use this. Use 'io.WantCaptureMouse' instead! Please read the FAQ!
ImGuiFocusedFlags_.name: ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow

ImGuiFocusedFlags_.comment: // Do not consider popup hierarchy (do not treat popup emitter as parent of popup) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
ImGuiFocusedFlags_.name: ImGuiFocusedFlags_NoPopupHierarchy

ImGuiFocusedFlags_.comment: // Consider docking hierarchy (treat dockspace host as parent of docked window) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
ImGuiFocusedFlags_.name: ImGuiFocusedFlags_DockHierarchy

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // Return true if directly over the item/window, not obstructed by another window, not obstructed by an active popup or modal blocking inputs under them.
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_None

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsWindowHovered() only: Return true if any children of the window is hovered
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsWindowHovered() only: Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy)
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsWindowHovered() only: Return true if any window is hovered
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsWindowHovered() only: Do not consider popup hierarchy (do not treat popup emitter as parent of popup) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoPopupHierarchy

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsWindowHovered() only: Consider docking hierarchy (treat dockspace host as parent of docked window) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_DockHierarchy

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // Return true even if a popup window is normally blocking access to this item/window
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // Return true even if an active item is blocking access to this item/window. Useful for Drag and Drop patterns.
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the item uses AllowOverlap mode and is overlapped by another hoverable item.
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByItem

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the position is obstructed or overlapped by another window.
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByWindow

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the item is disabled
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsItemHovered() only: Disable using gamepad/keyboard navigation state when active, always query mouse
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoNavOverride

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // Shortcut for standard flags when using IsItemHovered() + SetTooltip() sequence.
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // Require mouse to be stationary for style.HoverStationaryDelay (~0.15 sec) _at least one time_. After this, can move on same item/window. Using the stationary test tends to reduces the need for a long delay.
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsItemHovered() only: Return true immediately (default). As this is the default you generally ignore this.
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNone

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsItemHovered() only: Return true after style.HoverDelayShort elapsed (~0.15 sec) (shared between items) + requires mouse to be stationary for style.HoverStationaryDelay (once per item).
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsItemHovered() only: Return true after style.HoverDelayNormal elapsed (~0.40 sec) (shared between items) + requires mouse to be stationary for style.HoverStationaryDelay (once per item).
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal

ImGuiHoveredFlags_.comment: // IsItemHovered() only: Disable shared delay system where moving from one item to the next keeps the previous timer for a short time (standard for tooltips with long delays)
ImGuiHoveredFlags_.name: ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Allow 0123456789ABCDEFabcdef
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Turn a..z into A..Z
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Filter out spaces, tabs
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Select entire text when first taking mouse focus
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Return 'true' when Enter is pressed (as opposed to every time the value was modified). Consider looking at the IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() function.
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Callback on pressing TAB (for completion handling)
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows (for history handling)
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Callback on each iteration. User code may query cursor position, modify text buffer.
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them. Modify 'EventChar' to replace or discard, or return 1 in callback to discard.
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Pressing TAB input a '\t' character into the text field
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // In multi-line mode, unfocus with Enter, add new line with Ctrl+Enter (default is opposite: unfocus with Ctrl+Enter, add line with Enter).
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Disable following the cursor horizontally
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoHorizontalScroll

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Overwrite mode
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysOverwrite

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Read-only mode
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Password mode, display all characters as '*'
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Disable undo/redo. Note that input text owns the text data while active, if you want to provide your own undo/redo stack you need e.g. to call ClearActiveID().
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoUndoRedo

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Allow 0123456789.+-*/eE (Scientific notation input)
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Callback on buffer capacity changes request (beyond 'buf_size' parameter value), allowing the string to grow. Notify when the string wants to be resized (for string types which hold a cache of their Size). You will be provided a new BufSize in the callback and NEED to honor it. (see misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for an example of using this)
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Callback on any edit (note that InputText() already returns true on edit, the callback is useful mainly to manipulate the underlying buffer while focus is active)
ImGuiInputTextFlags_.name: ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit

ImGuiInputTextFlags_.comment: // Escape key clears content if not empty, and deactivate otherwise (contrast to default behavior of Escape to revert)

ImDrawListSplitter.above:
// Split/Merge functions are used to split the draw list into different layers which can be drawn into out of order.
// This is used by the Columns/Tables API, so items of each column can be batched together in a same draw call.

ImFont.above:
// Font runtime data and rendering
// ImFontAtlas automatically loads a default embedded font for you when you call GetTexDataAsAlpha8() or GetTexDataAsRGBA32().

ImFontGlyph.above:
// Hold rendering data for one glyph.
// (Note: some language parsers may fail to convert the 31+1 bitfield members, in this case maybe drop store a single u32 or we can rework this)

ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder.above:
// Helper to build glyph ranges from text/string data. Feed your application strings/characters to it then call BuildRanges().
// This is essentially a tightly packed of vector of 64k booleans = 8KB storage.

ImGuiKeyData.above:
// [Internal] Storage used by IsKeyDown(), IsKeyPressed() etc functions.
// If prior to 1.87 you used io.KeysDownDuration[] (which was marked as internal), you should use GetKeyData(key)->DownDuration and *NOT* io.KeysData[key]->DownDuration.

ImGuiOnceUponAFrame.above:
// Helper: Execute a block of code at maximum once a frame. Convenient if you want to quickly create a UI within deep-nested code that runs multiple times every frame.
// Usage: static ImGuiOnceUponAFrame oaf; if (oaf) ImGui::Text("This will be called only once per frame");

ImGuiPayload.above: // Data payload for Drag and Drop operations: AcceptDragDropPayload(), GetDragDropPayload()

ImGuiPlatformImeData.above: // (Optional) Support for IME (Input Method Editor) via the io.SetPlatformImeDataFn() function.

ImGuiPlatformMonitor.above:
// (Optional) This is required when enabling multi-viewport. Represent the bounds of each connected monitor/display and their DPI.
// We use this information for multiple DPI support + clamping the position of popups and tooltips so they don't straddle multiple monitors.

ImGuiSizeCallbackData.above:
// Resizing callback data to apply custom constraint. As enabled by SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(). Callback is called during the next Begin().

comment.sameline: // Custom texture rectangle ID for white pixel and mouse cursors
// Custom texture rectangle ID for baked anti-aliased lines
// Input    // Desired rectangle dimension
// Input    // Desired rectangle dimension
// Output   // Packed position in Atlas
// Output   // Packed position in Atlas
// Input    // For custom font glyphs only (ID < 0x110000)
// Input    // For custom font glyphs only: glyph xadvance
// Input    // For custom font glyphs only: glyph display offset
// Input    // For custom font glyphs only: target font
//          // TTF/OTF data
//          // TTF/OTF data size
// true     // TTF/OTF data ownership taken by the container ImFontAtlas (will delete memory itself).
// 0        // Index of font within TTF/OTF file
//          // Size in pixels for rasterizer (more or less maps to the resulting font height).

// 2        // Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning. Note the difference between 2 and 3 is minimal. You can reduce this to 1 for large glyphs save memory. Read https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/tests/oversample/README.md for details.
// 1        // Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning. This is not really useful as we don't use sub-pixel positions on the Y axis.
// false    // Align every glyph to pixel boundary. Useful e.g. if you are merging a non-pixel aligned font with the default font. If enabled, you can set OversampleH/V to 1.
// 0, 0     // Extra spacing (in pixels) between glyphs. Only X axis is supported for now.
// 0, 0     // Offset all glyphs from this font input.
// NULL     // THE ARRAY DATA NEEDS TO PERSIST AS LONG AS THE FONT IS ALIVE. Pointer to a user-provided list of Unicode range (2 value per range, values are inclusive, zero-terminated list).
// 0        // Minimum AdvanceX for glyphs, set Min to align font icons, set both Min/Max to enforce mono-space font
// FLT_MAX  // Maximum AdvanceX for glyphs

// false    // Merge into previous ImFont, so you can combine multiple inputs font into one ImFont (e.g. ASCII font + icons + Japanese glyphs). You may want to use GlyphOffset.y when merge font of different heights.
// 0        // Settings for custom font builder. THIS IS BUILDER IMPLEMENTATION DEPENDENT. Leave as zero if unsure.
// 1.0f     // Linearly brighten (>1.0f) or darken (<1.0f) font output. Brightening small fonts may be a good workaround to make them more readable. This is a silly thing we may remove in the future.

// 1.0f     // DPI scale for rasterization, not altering other font metrics: make it easy to swap between e.g. a 100% and a 400% fonts for a zooming display. IMPORTANT: If you increase this it is expected that you increase font scale accordingly, otherwise quality may look lowered.
// -1       // Explicitly specify unicode codepoint of ellipsis character. When fonts are being merged first specified ellipsis will be used.

comment.above: // Docking options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable is set)
comment.sameline: // = false          // Simplified docking mode: disable window splitting, so docking is limited to merging multiple windows together into tab-bars.
// = false          // Enable docking with holding Shift key (reduce visual noise, allows dropping in wider space)
// = false          // [BETA] [FIXME: This currently creates regression with auto-sizing and general overhead] Make every single floating window display within a docking node.

// = false          // [BETA] Make window or viewport transparent when docking and only display docking boxes on the target viewport. Useful if rendering of multiple viewport cannot be synced. Best used with ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge.

comment.above: // Viewport options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable is set)
comment.sameline: // = false;         // Set to make all floating imgui windows always create their own viewport. Otherwise, they are merged into the main host viewports when overlapping it. May also set ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge on individual viewport.
// = false          // Disable default OS task bar icon flag for secondary viewports. When a viewport doesn't want a task bar icon, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon will be set on it.

// = true           // Disable default OS window decoration flag for secondary viewports. When a viewport doesn't want window decorations, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration will be set on it. Enabling decoration can create subsequent issues at OS levels (e.g. minimum window size).

// = false          // Disable default OS parenting to main viewport for secondary viewports. By default, viewports are marked with ParentViewportId = <main_viewport>, expecting the platform backend to setup a parent/child relationship between the OS windows (some backend may ignore this). Set to true if you want the default to be 0, then all viewports will be top-level OS windows.

comment.above: // Miscellaneous options
comment.sameline: // = false          // Request ImGui to draw a mouse cursor for you (if you are on a platform without a mouse cursor). Cannot be easily renamed to 'io.ConfigXXX' because this is frequently used by backend implementations.

// = defined(__APPLE__) // OS X style: Text editing cursor movement using Alt instead of Ctrl, Shortcuts using Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl, Line/Text Start and End using Cmd+Arrows instead of Home/End, Double click selects by word instead of selecting whole text, Multi-selection in lists uses Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl.

// = true           // Enable input queue trickling: some types of events submitted during the same frame (e.g. button down + up) will be spread over multiple frames, improving interactions with low framerates.
// = true           // Enable blinking cursor (optional as some users consider it to be distracting).
// = false          // [BETA] Pressing Enter will keep item active and select contents (single-line only).
// = false          // [BETA] Enable turning DragXXX widgets into text input with a simple mouse click-release (without moving). Not desirable on devices without a keyboard.

// = true           // Enable resizing of windows from their edges and from the lower-left corner. This requires (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors) because it needs mouse cursor feedback. (This used to be a per-window ImGuiWindowFlags_ResizeFromAnySide flag)
// = false       // Enable allowing to move windows only when clicking on their title bar. Does not apply to windows without a title bar.
// = 60.0f          // Timer (in seconds) to free transient windows/tables memory buffers when unused. Set to -1.0f to disable.

// . . U . .  // Create a new platform window for the given viewport
// . . U . .  // Newly created windows are initially hidden so SetWindowPos/Size/Title can be called on them before showing the window
// . . U . .  // Set platform window position (given the upper-left corner of client area)
// . . U . .  // Set platform window client area size (ignoring OS decorations such as OS title bar etc.)
// N . . . .  // Get platform window client area size
// N . . . .  // Move window to front and set input focus
// N . . . .  // Get platform window minimized state. When minimized, we generally won't attempt to get/set size and contents will be culled more easily
// . . U . .  // Set platform window title (given an UTF-8 string)
// . . U . .  // (Optional) Setup global transparency (not per-pixel transparency)
// . . U . .  // (Optional) Called by UpdatePlatformWindows(). Optional hook to allow the platform backend from doing general book-keeping every frame.

// . . . R .  // (Optional) Main rendering (platform side! This is often unused, or just setting a "current" context for OpenGL bindings). 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
// . . . R .  // (Optional) Call Present/SwapBuffers (platform side! This is often unused!). 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
// N . . . .  // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling: Return DPI scale for this viewport. 1.0f = 96 DPI.
// . F . . .  // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling: Called during Begin() every time the viewport we are outputting into changes, so backend has a chance to swap fonts to adjust style.
// (Optional) For a Vulkan Renderer to call into Platform code (since the surface creation needs to tie them both).

comment.sameline: // Global alpha applies to everything in Dear ImGui.
// Additional alpha multiplier applied by BeginDisabled(). Multiply over current value of Alpha.
// Padding within a window.
// Radius of window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows. Large values tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.
// Thickness of border around windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
// Minimum window size. This is a global setting. If you want to constrain individual windows, use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints().
// Alignment for title bar text. Defaults to (0.0f,0.5f) for left-aligned,vertically centered.
// Side of the collapsing/docking button in the title bar (None/Left/Right). Defaults to ImGuiDir_Left.
// Radius of child window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows.
// Thickness of border around child windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
// Radius of popup window corners rounding. (Note that tooltip windows use WindowRounding)
// Thickness of border around popup/tooltip windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
// Padding within a framed rectangle (used by most widgets).
// Radius of frame corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular frame (used by most widgets).
// Thickness of border around frames. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
// Horizontal and vertical spacing between widgets/lines.
// Horizontal and vertical spacing between within elements of a composed widget (e.g. a slider and its label).
// Padding within a table cell. CellPadding.y may be altered between different rows.

// Expand reactive bounding box for touch-based system where touch position is not accurate enough. Unfortunately we don't sort widgets so priority on overlap will always be given to the first widget. So don't grow this too much!
// Horizontal indentation when e.g. entering a tree node. Generally == (FontSize + FramePadding.x*2).
// Minimum horizontal spacing between two columns. Preferably > (FramePadding.x + 1).
// Width of the vertical scrollbar, Height of the horizontal scrollbar.
// Radius of grab corners for scrollbar.
// Minimum width/height of a grab box for slider/scrollbar.
// Radius of grabs corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular slider grabs.
// The size in pixels of the dead-zone around zero on logarithmic sliders that cross zero.
// Radius of upper corners of a tab. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular tabs.
// Thickness of border around tabs.
// Minimum width for close button to appear on an unselected tab when hovered. Set to 0.0f to always show when hovering, set to FLT_MAX to never show close button unless selected.
// Thickness of tab-bar separator, which takes on the tab active color to denote focus.
// Angle of angled headers (supported values range from -50.0f degrees to +50.0f degrees).
// Side of the color button in the ColorEdit4 widget (left/right). Defaults to ImGuiDir_Right.
// Alignment of button text when button is larger than text. Defaults to (0.5f, 0.5f) (centered).
// Alignment of selectable text. Defaults to (0.0f, 0.0f) (top-left aligned). It's generally important to keep this left-aligned if you want to lay multiple items on a same line.
// Thickkness of border in SeparatorText()
// Alignment of text within the separator. Defaults to (0.0f, 0.5f) (left aligned, center).
// Horizontal offset of text from each edge of the separator + spacing on other axis. Generally small values. .y is recommended to be == FramePadding.y.
// Window position are clamped to be visible within the display area or monitors by at least this amount. Only applies to regular windows.
// If you cannot see the edges of your screen (e.g. on a TV) increase the safe area padding. Apply to popups/tooltips as well regular windows. NB: Prefer configuring your TV sets correctly!
// Thickness of resizing border between docked windows
// Scale software rendered mouse cursor (when io.MouseDrawCursor is enabled). We apply per-monitor DPI scaling over this scale. May be removed later.
// Enable anti-aliased lines/borders. Disable if you are really tight on CPU/GPU. Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).

// Enable anti-aliased lines/borders using textures where possible. Require backend to render with bilinear filtering (NOT point/nearest filtering). Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).
// Enable anti-aliased edges around filled shapes (rounded rectangles, circles, etc.). Disable if you are really tight on CPU/GPU. Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).
// Tessellation tolerance when using PathBezierCurveTo() without a specific number of segments. Decrease for highly tessellated curves (higher quality, more polygons), increase to reduce quality.

// Maximum error (in pixels) allowed when using AddCircle()/AddCircleFilled() or drawing rounded corner rectangles with no explicit segment count specified. Decrease for higher quality but more geometry.

comment.sameline: // Delay for IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary). Time required to consider mouse stationary.
// Delay for IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort). Usually used along with HoverStationaryDelay.
// Delay for IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal). "
// Default flags when using IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip) or BeginItemTooltip()/SetItemTooltip() while using mouse.
// Default flags when using IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip) or BeginItemTooltip()/SetItemTooltip() while using keyboard/gamepad.
// User id of the column (if specified by a TableSetupColumn() call)
// Index of the column
// Index within parent ImGuiTableSortSpecs (always stored in order starting from 0, tables sorted on a single criteria will always have a 0 here)
// ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending or ImGuiSortDirection_Descending
// Pointer to sort spec array.
// Sort spec count. Most often 1. May be > 1 when ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti is enabled. May be == 0 when ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate is enabled.
// Set to true when specs have changed since last time! Use this to sort again, then clear the flag.
// Unique identifier for the viewport
// See ImGuiViewportFlags_
// Main Area: Position of the viewport (Dear ImGui coordinates are the same as OS desktop/native coordinates)
// Main Area: Size of the viewport.
// Work Area: Position of the viewport minus task bars, menus bars, status bars (>= Pos)
// Work Area: Size of the viewport minus task bars, menu bars, status bars (<= Size)
// 1.0f = 96 DPI = No extra scale.
// (Advanced) 0: no parent. Instruct the platform backend to setup a parent/child relationship between platform windows.
// The ImDrawData corresponding to this viewport. Valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame().
// void* to hold custom data structure for the renderer (e.g. swap chain, framebuffers etc.). generally set by your Renderer_CreateWindow function.
// void* to hold custom data structure for the OS / platform (e.g. windowing info, render context). generally set by your Platform_CreateWindow function.
// void* for FindViewportByPlatformHandle(). (e.g. suggested to use natural platform handle such as HWND, GLFWWindow*, SDL_Window*)

// void* to hold lower-level, platform-native window handle (under Win32 this is expected to be a HWND, unused for other platforms), when using an abstraction layer like GLFW or SDL (where PlatformHandle would be a SDL_Window*)
// Platform window has been created (Platform_CreateWindow() has been called). This is false during the first frame where a viewport is being created.
// Platform window requested move (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window manager, authoritative position will be OS window position)
// Platform window requested resize (e.g. window was resized by the OS / host window manager, authoritative size will be OS window size)
// Platform window requested closure (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window manager, e.g. pressing ALT-F4)
// User data. 0 = Default class (unclassed). Windows of different classes cannot be docked with each others.

// Hint for the platform backend. -1: use default. 0: request platform backend to not parent the platform. != 0: request platform backend to create a parent<>child relationship between the platform windows. Not conforming backends are free to e.g. parent every viewport to the main viewport or not.
// ID of parent window for shortcut focus route evaluation, e.g. Shortcut() call from Parent Window will succeed when this window is focused.
// Viewport flags to set when a window of this class owns a viewport. This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar icon, override the defaults on a per-window basis.
// Viewport flags to clear when a window of this class owns a viewport. This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar icon, override the defaults on a per-window basis.
// [EXPERIMENTAL] TabItem flags to set when a window of this class gets submitted into a dock node tab bar. May use with ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading or ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing.
// [EXPERIMENTAL] Dock node flags to set when a window of this class is hosted by a dock node (it doesn't have to be selected!)
// Set to true to enforce single floating windows of this class always having their own docking node (equivalent of setting the global io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar)
